title: Marionette
description: On top of Backbone works Marionette to provide useful features like complex views and module management.

title: Radio
description: Backbone.Radio replaces the currently used Backbone.Wreqr. It provides event based communication using events, requests and commands.

title: jQuery
description: Backbone and Marionette need a library for DOM manipulations and we use jQuery for that. However, it is also possible to replace it with an API compatible library like Zepto.

title: lodash
description: Instead using underscore, the utility library recommended for Backbone, battle-backbone uses the compatible library lodash. It provides believed to be faster and provides more functions than underscore.

title: require.js
description: Dependency management and dynamic resource loading is done by require.js. Plugins for CSS loading and plain-text files are included.

title: Tooling
description: A modern and scalable toolchain to build a battle-backbone application and make it ready for deployment.

title: CoffeeScript
description: It's writen in CoffeeScript to keep it readable and short.
